body:
Note to self; Direct link to its Travis Build; https://travis-ci.org/ipython/ipython/builds/40338763
I'm  learning how Travis operates. I found out that its first 'failed checks' message really just means failure is the default before the build finishes.

```
Waiting to hear about 5d06103 — The Travis CI build is in progress · Details
This branch has failed checks, but can be merged.
Only those with write access to this repository can merge pull requests.
```

//update Build finished and passed in ~12m, and it shows that numerous Python versions were tested, all on Linux boxes.

```
Build Matrix Job    Duration    Finished    Python  ENV     OS
9294.1  10 min 41 sec   3 minutes ago   3.4     GROUP=js    linux
9294.2  4 min 2 sec     10 minutes ago  3.4     GROUP=  linux
9294.3  9 min 56 sec    5 minutes ago   2.7     GROUP=js    linux
9294.4  3 min 19 sec    11 minutes ago  2.7     GROUP=  linux
9294.5  4 min 36 sec    9 minutes ago   3.3     GROUP=  linux
```

It appears that Travis-ci only marginally supports OSX builds and does not yet support Windows.
Docs stating OSX is experimental and low capacity for free builds. http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/multi-os/
Ticket to ask for OSX and Windows support. https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/216

Looking at the code, I think it is intended to be specifically on Windows with Python 2, not Windows or Python 2. It encodes the arguments as cp1252, which is unlikely to be the right default on non-Windows systems.

#6263 appears to describe a different problem that happens to have the same symptoms - the reporter did not have pdflatex available. Is it possible that this is what you're seeing too?

Thank you @takluyver , I didn't know about cp1252 being Windows-specific [1].

I think I'm  almost done untangling it. The error messages differ from the Python standard library call. The Python 3 library provides the offending file's information in its message [2], and indeed now I can see that it complains I lack pdflatex [3].

It is now possible to easily test for a command  in python 3's which [4].

I changed my PR so that it has better doc [5].
AnneTheAgile

[1] Windows-1252 or CP-1252 is a character encoding of the Latin alphabet, used by default in the legacy components of Microsoft Windows in English and some other Western languages. It is one version within the group of Windows code pages.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows-1252

[2] Quick tests for the file subprocess messaging on py2 vs py3. SO showed a simple test that gives this error. 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18962785/oserror-errno-2-no-such-file-or-directory-while-using-python-subprocess-in-dj

Python 2.7 omits the offender's name

```
$ python
Python 2.7.6 (v2.7.6:3a1db0d2747e, Nov 10 2013, 00:42:54) 
>>> import subprocess
>>> subprocess.call("echo hi")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 522, in call
    return Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs).wait()
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 709, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1326, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

>>> subprocess.call("echo hi",shell=True)
hi
0
```

Python 3.4 names the offender

```
>>> import subprocess
>>> subprocess.call("echo hi")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/subprocess.py", line 537, in call
    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as p:
  File "/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/subprocess.py", line 858, in __init__
    restore_signals, start_new_session)
  File "/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/subprocess.py", line 1456, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'echo hi'
```

[3] Using my local dev source version of IPython , plus a conda environment py3.4, I installed the prereqs needed to get it to run. I just used pip install for each requested item. Now it runs in this dev mode, and the error is confirmed to be pdflatex missing.

```
$ ipython nbconvert try2.ipynb --to pdf
[NbConvertApp] Using existing profile dir: '/Users/me/.ipython/profile_default'
[NbConvertApp] Converting notebook try2.ipynb to pdf
[NbConvertApp] Support files will be in try2_files/

[NbConvertApp] Building PDF
[NbConvertApp] Running pdflatex 3 times: ['pdflatex', 'notebook.tex']
--- Logging error ---

    return fmt.format(record)

    return super(LevelFormatter, self).format(record)
  File "/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/logging/__init__.py", line 565, in format

  File "/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/logging/__init__.py", line 328, in getMessage

TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting
Call stack:

  File "/Users/me/src/ipy-dev/IPython/nbconvert/nbconvertapp.py", line 261, in start

Message: 'Your Shell command  is: latex_command, aka : '
Arguments: ('pdflatex',)

```

[4] shutil — High-level file operations — Python 3.5.0a0 documentation
https://docs.python.org/dev/library/shutil.html
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/377017/test-if-executable-exists-in-python

```
Python 3.4.2 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, Oct 21 2014, 17:42:20)
>>> ans = shutil.which("python")
>>> print(ans)
/Users/me/anaconda/envs/py34/bin/python

>>> ans = shutil.which("pdflatex")
>>> print(ans)
None
>>> if (shutil.which("pdflatex")==None):
...   print('oor')
...
oor
```

[5] I added a new method and have it called before each run.

```
$ grep -in "def valid_on" ipython/nbconvert/exporters/pdf.py -A 3
41:    def valid_on_path(self, command):
42-        """Ensure the given command exists in the OS PATH."""
43-        if  (shutil.which(command)==None) :
44-            raise FileNotFoundError("NBConvert requires this command to be on the System PATH: "+str(command))

$ ipython nbconvert try2.ipynb --to pdf
//etc
    raise FileNotFoundError("NBConvert requires this command to be on the System PATH: "+str(command))
FileNotFoundError: NBConvert requires this command to be on the System PATH: pdflatex
```

@takluyver , I updated the title of this ticket to match my new commit: [NBConvert] Ensure commands needed for PDF/Bibtex are installed on the path.

Notes; 
1.[] Anaconda enables easily running pip installs that stay in one's local environment, but the docs don't make that crystal clear. ; ; ; ; ; ; ; ; ;  X.Conda FAQ — Conda documentation
http://conda.pydata.org/docs/faq.html

```
$ conda install -n myenv pip
$ source activate myenv
$ pip <pip_subcommand>
# pip install xyz will keep it in myenv
```

2.[] ; Aaron had a nice tip on writing errors here.; ; ; ; ;  X.How do I manually throw/raise an exception in python? - Stack Overflow
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2052390/how-do-i-manually-throw-raise-an-exception-in-python
2A.[] ;List of available generic errors shows that since this is an OS problem, the file not found is actually the most logical one to use.. ; ; ; ; ; ; ; ; ;  X.5. Built-in Exceptions — Python 3.4.2 documentation
https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#exception-hierarchy
3.[] PdfLatex is definitely required and called in these locations.
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=pdflatex&type=Code
4.[] IPython has a set of cool decorators, eg IPython.testing.decorators import onlyif_cmds_exist.
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/testing/decorators.py#L368
5.[] The single test for PDF convert only runs if both pdflatex and pandoc exist.
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/71256f5f771a542589ffe9780cba1dbea0bffafb/IPython/nbconvert/exporters/tests/test_pdf.py#L29

```
    @dec.onlyif_cmds_exist('pdflatex')
    @dec.onlyif_cmds_exist('pandoc')
    def test_export(self):
        """Smoke test PDFExporter"""
        (output, resources) = self.exporter_class(latex_count=1).from_filename(self._get_notebook())
        self.assertIsInstance(output, bytes)
        assert len(output) > 0
```

7.[] The PdfLatex file is a small part of a Tex Distribution.  ;  X.pdftex - Where to download pdflatex.exe? - TeX - LaTeX Stack Exchange
http://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/49569/where-to-download-pdflatex-exe
7A.[] Wikipedia for LaTex in general says "pdflatex, for example, calls the pdfTeX program using the standard LaTeX macros to typeset LaTeX documents." ; ; ; ; ;  X.pdfTeX - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PdfTeX
7B.[] Latex for the impatient lists distros.   ; ;  X.Obtaining LaTeX
http://latex-project.org/ftp.html
7C.[] YIKES! 2.3GB Compressed for this one,  ; ;  X.MacTeX - TeX Users Group
http://www.tug.org/mactex/

8.[] Wait! Ipynb includes the util I wrote; 
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/testing/decorators.py#L66

```
# For onlyif_cmd_exists decorator
from IPython.utils.process import is_cmd_found
```

8A.[] Its source, 
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/utils/process.py#L72

```
def is_cmd_found(cmd):
    """Check whether executable `cmd` exists or not and return a bool."""
    try:
        find_cmd(cmd)
        return True
    except FindCmdError:
        return False
```

6.[] So I want TODO; 
[]New decorator, do only if command does not exist; ensure that exception is thrown.
[]New test; if any one of the commands doesn't exist, ensure it throws an error.
[]Refactor to import IPy is_cmd_found.
[]Git rebase.

OK, now I also need to look into how to git squash / rebase to elide the unnecessary commits.

More notes to self.
1.[] The IPython Version string is computed from major.minor.patch-extra.
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/71256f5f771a542589ffe9780cba1dbea0bffafb/IPython/core/release.py#L22
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=release.version
1A.[] Any Python Module's version can be checked with   ;  X.How to check version of python modules? - Stack Overflow
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20180543/how-to-check-version-of-python-modules

```
>>> import statlib
>>> print statlib.__version__
```

2.[] A simple Hello World LaTeX is on this page.  ; ; ; ;  X.An introduction to LaTeX
http://latex-project.org/intro.html

```
\documentclass{article}
\title{Cartesian closed categories and the price of eggs}
\author{Jane Doe}
\date{September 1994}
\begin{document}
   \maketitle
   Hello world!
\end{document}
```

3.[] I did not yet fully do either of these two instructions from the IPython Readme. 
https://github.com/ipython/ipython/

```
# with Conda I installed without --user, and it was failing
$ pip install -e ".[notebook]" --user
# just checked out today so don't need this.
$ git submodule update
```

4.[] Github has a nice page, there is Query syntax that I've not used yet to search.
https://help.github.com/articles/searching-issues/
4A.[] Maybe the Query page is a nice cheat sheet to the API for tickets? One can pull out comments on issues and at the summary level, the number of comments
https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/comments/#list-comments-on-an-issue
https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/
https://developer.github.com/v3/
5.[] Git fu; my repo started as an old IPy clone. I updated today, but didn't commit. Now I have an odd Git message. 

```
$ git status
# On branch 6263-pdf-convert-popen-fail-after-latex
# Changes not staged for commit:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
#   (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
#
#   modified:   IPython/html/static/components (new commits)
```
We can't really on shutil.which(), because we still support python 2.7. But I think we have a similar function of our own somewhere in utils.
@takluyver yes you are so good! I found it while you were typing. I will refactor. Now I think I have a real plan.
@AnneTheAgile the 3.0 release is coming up soon. Do you plan on finishing this soon?
I have optimistically targeted this for the 3.0 milestone, but feel free to change that to 4.0 if that is more appropriate.
Adding this to our dev meeting for next Tuesday 9:30 am PST.
This needs a small patch and can then be merged for 3.0.
